project.teaser: The overreaching goal of KEYSTONE is to support the development of a sustainable, efficient, and safe transport system, allowing enforcement authorities to access data for the purpose of checking compliance with rules applied in the transport of goods and passengers. The aim...
project.objective: The overreaching goal of KEYSTONE is to support the development of a sustainable, efficient, and safe transport system, allowing enforcement authorities to access data for the purpose of checking compliance with rules applied in the transport of goods and passengers. The aim is to tailor standardised digital solutions that can be used from several realities to standardize the transport system. To demonstrate the validity of the solutions proposed, an app will be developed so that two highly diverse pilots can prove the efficiency of the KEYSTONE’s innovation. Using the gained experience to develop a seamless, interoperable, and intermodal digital transport ecosystem that can be replicated at European leveThe overreaching goal of KEYSTONE is to support the development of a sustainable, efficient and safe transport system. Allowing enforcement authorities to access data for the purpose of checking compliance with rules applying in the transport of goods and passengers. The aim is to tailor standardised digital solutions that can be used from several realities in order to standardize the transport system. In order to demonstrate the validity of the solutions proposed, an app will be developed so that two highly diverse pilots can prove the efficiency of the KEYSTONE’s innovation. Using the gained experience to develop a seamless, interoperable, and intermodal digital transport eco-system that can be replicated at European level. The KEYSTONE digital solutions consists of standardised APIs for data and information sharing between transport enforcement authorities and logistics operators based on a federated approach allowing to reduce the costs of logistics thanks to more efficient operations and interoperability, to reduce the impact on the environment thanks to data sharing, the possibility to consolidate flows and to improve safety thanks to seamless information exchange with enforcement authorities and the possibility to foster the acceptance of the CCAM solutions.
project.title: KNOWLEDGEABLE COMPREHENSIVE AND FULLY INTEGRATED SMART SOLUTION FOR RESILIENT, SUSTAINABLE AND OPTIMIZED TRANSPORT OPERATIONS
project.keywords: Road safety, logistics, smart enforcement, transport sustainability, resilience, API standardization, standards, DTLF group, CCAM, transport security, plug & play, compliance by design and by default

article.title: Digital solutions for an EU level safe transport ecosystem

result.title: The project’s data management plan
result.description: Consortiums detailed plan for managing the production collection and processing of its research data and scientific publications

result.title: Focus groups report including stakeholders’ requirements and expectations
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive overview of needs and challenges of key stakeholders in relation to information security and data protection, which will inform the functionality of the KEYSTONE solution.

result.title: Cyber security infrastructure for the KEYSTONE solution
result.description: D3.3 will ensure that ‘cyber security by design’ is an integral part of the KEYSTONE solutions in line with EU and international standards, and the creation, piloting and evaluation phases of the project.

result.title: API standard
result.description: Information on the created Python library and API documentation website. The Python library aims to be a “coding kit” for organisations that want to implement the API standard in their products. As such the deliverable will develop the full documentation of the library as well.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - KEYSTONE (KNOWLEDGEABLE COMPREHENSIVE AND FULLY INTEGRATED SMART SOLUTION FOR RESILIENT, SUSTAINABLE AND OPTIMIZED TRANSPORT OPERATIONS)
result.teaser: The KEYSTONE project aims to revolutionize goods transport by establishing a sustainable, efficient, and safe system through innovative digital solutions. By fostering collaboration between enforcement authorities and logistics operators, it seeks to create a harmonized...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: App launch and reporting
result.description: This deliverable includes the description of the web application for data exchange. Definition of technical requirements and timeline will be included as well.

result.title: Evaluation Methodology and Plan
result.description: This deliverable will summarize all the steps that need to be followed to perform a proper evaluation of all the KEYSTONE’s activities. It will contain all the methodologies and the explanation of the analysis that will be performed, and it will help the different activities understanding how to follow a concrete e correct evaluation process.

result.title: Digital ecosystem framework
result.description: This deliverable, outcome of T1.4, describes the process for generating the use-cases from the transport digital ecosystems in the use context and the related results (interface, functionality) gained through the focus group and through other sources. Furthermore, D1.4 will detail the use-cases identified including the description of the evaluation KPIs for KEYSTONE outputs in each context.

result.title: App design, architecture, and development plan
result.description: D3.1 will set technical and functional requirement of the KEYSTONE web app and highlight the application development plan.

result.title: Definition and specification of the operational scenarios
result.description: This report describes the demonstration scenarios defined by T4.2 for the two KEYSTONE pilots. It explains in detail the operational field, stakeholders’ involvement, specific needs, geographical focus, and peculiarities of both pilots, highlighting their synergies.

result.title: Co-created UI/UX design
result.description: This report summarizes the results of T3.2. It describes the methodology adopted for designing and evaluating the UI/UX of the KEYSTONE App.

result.title: Communication & dissemination plan and visual identity handbook
result.description: A detailed communication dissemination plan containing the methodology to be followed activity plans for all partners target audiences and a first editorial It also contains the visual identity handbook which consists of the final project logo branding guidelines and final templates for written report presentations and excel sheets

result.title: Needs and requirements for the future digital logistics ecosystem
result.description: This deliverable, outcome of T1.3 will provide the state of the art of currently available digital platforms and the gap to be overcome by the KEYSTONE solution for a full implementation of compliance.

result.title: Communication & dissemination plan update
result.description: A second version of the communication & dissemination plan contains an updated and more detailed work plan for all partners until the end of the project. In case any changes are necessary concerning the visual identity handbook, an update may also be included.

result.title: Plug & Play implementation and interconnectivity study
result.description: Implementation guide regarding interconnectivity between different data sources. The data sources considered are drivers, vehicles and infrastructure. The deliverable will present how the use-cases are used for the development of the guide and the connections executed with other platform with a special mention on the authentication mechanism of the APIs (using eID).

result.title: API Reference Model
result.description: Define the methodology used for creating API reference model. The methodology will research existing API standards/models and develop a new one considering also the Plug and Play implementation guidelines.

result.title: Process and procedures report based on the concrete use cases
result.description: Digital ecosystem’s impact on the way of working of the freight forwarding and intermodal management.

result.title: Stakeholders' identification and needs
result.description: This report provides the results of the stateofthe art analysis and the survey performed by T11 The report highlights needs barriers challenges and stakeholders expectations for deploying digitalised transport ecosystems

result.title: KEYSTONE: Transforming the European Transport Ecosystem Through Data-Driven Strategies, Operations, and Interoperability

details.authors: Alexeis Garcia Perez, Zoi Petrakou, Giulia Renzi, Paulo Cantillano, Andrew Jones, Kevin Broughton, Alexandros Papacharalampous, Alexandros Georgakopoulos, Charilaos Koutsis
details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Intelligent Transportation and Infrastructure, Climate Crisis and Resilient Transportation Systems

category.title: data exchange
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/data science/data exchange

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
